page.title: 12PETERHEAD LIFEBOAT STATION
page.content: The lifeboat service has been in Peterhead for over 110 years. The latest lifeboat,the James and Mariska Joicey,has been in service since 1969.It is Arun 54'.When it was bought in 1969,it cost Â£70 000. Nowadays it would be worth over Â£430 000.The boat has 7 crew members who are all unpaid volunteers.The lifeboat station is situated on Lodge Walk.The steep slipway goes straight into the South Bay.When an emergency arises,the crew are alerted by two loud bangs made by maroons. They rush down to the station along with many other Peterhead people who come to watch the launch of the James and Mariska Joicey.
